meta.title: Coronavirus (COVID-19) Information | ISD 191

body.class: html not-front not-logged-in one-sidebar sidebar-first page-node page-node- page-node-2819 node-type-custom-page with-navigation with-subnav featured dir-ltr section-coronavirus isd191

form.onsubmit: if(this.search_block_form.value=='Search'){ alert('Enter a search term...'); return false; }

input.title: Enter the terms you wish to search for.
input.name: search_block_form

a.title: Let us know you're here so we can connect you with resources.

li.class: menu-3557 menuparent menu-path-node-2819 active-trail even last

div.a: Buildings and programs will be closed to students, and distance learning will take place until at least May 4. Meal, childcare and distance learning information is available here.

div.p: This information is intended to update the District 191 community on our response plan to the outbreak of the novel coronavirus (COVID-19). The situation is rapidly-evolving and updates change daily as new information becomes available.
We are closely monitoring updates and guidance from the Minnesota Department of Health, Minnesota Department of Education and other national health organizations.

Burnsville-Eagan-Savage School District 191 will be closed to students through at least Monday, May 4. This includes all practices, activities and community education programs, including Project KIDS school-age care, Ready to Grow and Ready to Learn.

p.em: March 25, 2020 Update - This afternoon, Governor Tim Walz made an announcement extending the closure of schools to students until at least May 4, 2020.
I want to reassure you that this is what we have planned for. We are prepared to continue to serve Burnsville-Eagan-Savage School District 191 families through this extended closure.

hr.p: District 191 will provide Grab-and-Go meals for any child ages 1 to 18 on weekdays .
Meals are available for pickup at 12 locations around the community from 11 a.m. - 1 p.m. Find the location closest to you and more information on student meals.
District 191 will provide childcare for children of healthcare & emergency workers, and other designated employees (see who qualifies) on weekdays through at least May 4. Learn more about childcare.

Distance Learning provides students with access to appropriate educational materials and ensures they receive daily interaction with their licensed teachers. During this extended time, Distance Learning will be a different way for teachers to connect and provide instruction to students. Lessons will be carefully planned so students will continue to progress with their learning and improve their skills. Learn more about distance learning.

hr.h2: Guidelines to Prevent the Spread of COVID-19

ul.li: Wash your hands frequently with soap and water
Make sure children wash their hands well, especially after going to the bathroom, before eating and after blowing their nose
Cover your nose and mouth when coughing and sneezing
Stay home when you are sick
Keep kids home from school and activities when they are sick
Do not return to school or work until fever is gone for 24 hours without using fever-reducing medication
Avoid close contact with anyone with flu-like symptoms

li.a: Guide: Stop the Spread of Germs

h2.a: Playgrounds at District 191 school closed to public due to COVID-19

div.p: Following new guidance from the Centers for Disease Control (CDC), playgrounds at District 191 schools will be closed to public use due to the possibility of spreading COVID-19. According...

On Monday, March 30, Burnsville-Eagan-Savage School District 191 will begin distance learning for students.
